OOC: You really couldn't make it out in 5 seconds, but I'll go with 
it. I really wasn't planning on killing Vulois. He's just getting a 
personality change.

Vulois saw them run out as the his clock ticked down. No point in 
sacrifing himself. With just under a second to spare, Vulois stopped 
his countdown to think.

"I may still be alive, but what I said was true. My mission is over. 
There is no point in going back to Child now. We would just go back 
to the mountain and be prone for another attack. It's Child and 
Herald's turn to go about peace. I've got nothing left except this 
mountain. Wait, I need to make it convincing!"

Vulois went to tank mode and loaded a rocket. He went down a tiny bit 
into one of the wrong tunnels, and fired. He was almost buried in 
rock. He was barely escaped as the rocket exploded just before it 
left the mountain surface so no one saw it. The explosion threw fiery 
pieces of rock into the sky. He hoped that at least some of them 
could die. But the important thing was....he was finaly free. 

"Convix? Are you there?"

Yes Vulois, but I will be leaving you soon.

Am I keeping my powers?

A small fraction of it as gratitude for your work. But once I leave 
you will be back to plain old normal Vulois, the Predacon.

But what about the Peace Talks?

Child will do it. If Nemesis doesn't bother him. Windrazor will se to 
it that he remembers the task.

But what can I do?

What woudl you like to do? You are free from your duty. You may do 
anything you like.

I.....I want to go to Cybertron. There is work being done here, but 
not there. Both sides will have to work together in order for us to 
be saved from the nebula. I will start a small peace group there, 
focusing on organic parts. But...there is one other thing I would 
like to do first.

What is that?

I want to say good-bye to Battera and Cybershark. Before I go through 
The Gateway that we discovered, I will swing by the Cybertronian Fire 
and say good-bye.

Are you sure, Vulois? If you go, you may not like what you find. It 
may make you want to stay, and believe you have another mission.

But I must! They have been the closest to me, especially Battera. I 
must see them, at least once, even if they are different.

So be it. If you leave you will be seen. I will take you to the 
Cybertronian Fire.

Hold on a sec.

Vulois went to bot mode and walked down that hallway, to find the 
drawing of AngelNemesis. He took his finger and begin to draw beside 
it. When he was finished, it was the picture of a small bot, casting 
out this monster form the land, and below it he wrote:

                    The Chosen Child will be our Saviour

He spoke to Convix.

I am ready. Take me.

Very well. When you get there, your power will be drained a bit and I 
will no longer be here to speak with you. Good-bye Vulois

Good-bye Convix. Thank You for everything.

And with that, Vulois vanished from the mountain, and from all of his 
friends lives.
